communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: State admin budget item
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all supporting documents related to the following agenda item from the Sept. 10, 2024 regular meeting of the State Administrative Board: 
 
“4.) Deloitte Consulting, LLP, Detroit, MI
• $16,976,880.80 Amendment
• $115,113,568.74 New Total
• FY24-FY26 50% General Funds, 50% Federal Funds
• 071B5500113 Add funds and exercise an option year for the Case 
Management System. DTMB on behalf of MDHHS.”

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Liss

communications.subject: Re: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Amber Bingham
communications.communication:
Good morning; 

Hope you are doing well today. 

Unfortunately, we do not have any records for a Amber Marie Bingham. 

Ms. Bingham does not have any arrests, offenses, traffic citations, domestic, gang referrals or any other relevant information in our records management system. 

However, Acworth borders four (4) counties, meaning they all have Acworth addresses, but are not in the Municipal City of Acworth (where you made the request). 

Bartow, Cherokee, Cobb and Paulding counties all have Acworth address, but are not in the City of Acworth. 

If you can tell me the address, I can pinpoint the Agency. 

This will complete your request. 

Hope you have a great week! 

With kind regards, 

Dori Askew 
Records Division

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: John Lester Hubbard Chafee
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records, specifically those unreleased, mentioning or describing John Lester Hubbard Chafee, or John Chafee, who was the former governor of Rhode Island. He also served as the Secretary of the Navy and as a United States Senator. He was born on on Oct. 22, 1922 and died on Oct. 24, 1999. (Obituary: https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-1999-oct-26-mn-26438-story.html)

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please search HQ records as well as ALL field offices and resident agencies.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

He was born on Nov. 26, 1930 and died Jan. 24, 2012. (Obituary: https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/providence-ri/j-garrahy-10574589)

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please search HQ records as well as ALL field offices and resident agencies.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all available records related to Clifford Herman Forster, born July 6, 1913, in Manhattan, New York, and died August 1, 2016, in Manhattan, New York.

Clifford Forster was a Yale Law School graduate (Class of 1935 and 1938) and later became an ACLU lawyer. Yale University had a significant number of alumni who were involved with the Office of Strategic Services (OSS) during World War II, and it is believed that Clifford Forster was connected to the OSS as part of his service.

Specifically, I am seeking:
- Any records of military service, including enlistment, discharge, or summaries, particularly related to Clifford Forster's work with the OSS during World War II.
- Any documentation related to his reported involvement with the French Resistance.
- Any records or information regarding an alleged relationship between Clifford Forster and a childhood friend who later became a bodyguard for Adolf Hitler and allegedly acted as a source of intelligence for Allied forces.
- Any information on the following awards that Clifford Forster reportedly received:
   - Jeanne D’Arc Medal, awarded by French General Pierre DeBenouville.
   - Commemorative Medal Assembly of Captive European Nations.
   - Commander Order of Merit, awarded by a West German Governor.

If clarification is needed, please contact me. Thank you for your consideration.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alex Seneco

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Betty Jean Belt (1959 – 1975)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Betty Jean Belt (1959-1975).

Her death was covered by The Central New Jersey Home News Tribune many times since her passing in 1975, most recently in 2019: https://www.mycentraljersey.com/story/news/crime/jersey-mayhem/cold-cases/2019/05/23/nj-cold-case-who-killed-16-year-old-east-brunswick-girl-1975/2850239002/

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an writer and journalist who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the New York Times, the Washington Post, Rolling Stone, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. I am also a standing member of the American Society of Journalist and Authors. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Neumyer

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Disaster Supplies Expenditure
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Expenditures for any provision of disaster supplies to individuals and households, including but not limited to bottled water, lighting supplies, and food products for the years 2000-2024. These may be recorded as annual totals, provisioned by Disaster Number, or unaggregated. Expenditures may include direct provision, contracted provision, or provision via another entity such as contribution to an interagency effort.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Johanna Rayl

log number is 24-67549-F.

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Colchester vital records catalog
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A complete catalog, inventory, index, log, report, or other listing of (1) all the books in your possession or control which registrars used to record birth, marriages, deaths, and burials before 1900 (including any Land Records books and/or Town or Proprietors Meeting/Minutes/Record books which include any records of birth, marriages and deaths) and (2) other books, records, and documents in your possession or control which index, copy, regroup, reference or support town birth, deaths and marriages, including communications or reports of communication from ministers, justices of the peace, sextons, and other witnesses to any aspect of births, marriages, burials, and/or deaths prior to 1900.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications about Election Integrity
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records that contain any of the following keywords:
 “Claremont” 
@claremont.org
“True The Vote”
@truethevote.org
“Constitutional Sheriffs and Peace Officers Association” 
 “CSPOA”
@cspoa.org
“Catherine Engelbrecht”
“Gregg Phillips” 
“Richard Mack”
“Mike Lindell”
“Mark Lamb”
“Cause of America”
“Election integrity”
“Voter fraud”
“Election fraud”
“Drop box”
“Dropbox”
“Voting machine”
“Dominion”
“Non-citizen voting”
“Illegal voting”
“Illegals voting”
“Only Citizens Vote”

2. Receipts, confirmations and correspondence related to any and all lodging arrangements, transportation, including but not limited to air and ground transportation, meals, incidental expenses, and any other event-related expenses arranged, coordinated, sponsored, and/or paid for by any of the entities listed above.

3. Calendars, calendar invites, and other scheduling records for the Sheriff related to any and all events and meetings. 

The search for records requested above may be limited between January 1, 2024 through to the date of your final response. 

The search for records should include emails, attachments, both sent and received, scheduling records, text messages, mobile-phone-based/computer-based text communications including but not limited to Telegram, Signal, WhatsApp, materials received from postal mail, handouts, agendas, meeting packets and any other records containing the keywords and email domains in the request. 

Please note that the Sheriff and staff are acting in their official capacity when coordinating matters with outside entities, such as the CSPOA, that relate to official business. The search for records should also include all email accounts used to conduct official business, including personal email addresses such as a "gmail" or "yahoo" account.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Karen Goll.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia Pay-to-Stay Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For each fiscal year from FY2019 through FY2023:
1. The operating budget for the Virginia Department of Corrections
2. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were charged or assessed on inmates
3. The total amount of medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were charged or assessed on inmates
4. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were paid by inmates and collected by the Virginia Department of Corrections
5. The total amount of medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were paid by inmates and collected by the Virginia Department of Corrections
6. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were unpaid and turned into outstanding balance or debt
7. The total amount of outstanding medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were unpaid and turned into outstanding balance or debt
8. The total number of incarcerated adults who were charged room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration
9. The total number of incarcerated adults who were charged medical fees, including medical co-pays
10. The total number of incarcerated adults who participated in work-release or occupational/employment programs
11. The hourly rate of the work-release or occupational/employment programs operating under the department’s jurisdiction
12. The total amount of income earned by incarcerated adults employed in work-release or occupational/employment programs
13. The amount and percentage of the income from work release or occupational/employment programs that was used to cover the costs of inmates’ incarceration or care
14. Any policies and procedures relating to the imposition, collection, and enforcement of fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration or care

communications.communication:
Dear Jenny: 
 
Thank you for your interest in information from the Chicago Police Department. Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: P980540-091224 
You have requested the following records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Resolution and property letters sent in accordance with the Chicago Drug and Gang, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses ordinance (Sec 8-40-090) in Chicago's City Code for the following addresses:

1310 S Christiana Ave

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Teriq Lewis-Rushing Autopsy and Medical Examiner's Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the autopsy report, medical examiner's report and supporting documentation for 
First name: Teriq
Middle name: Reacon
Last name: Lewis-Rushing
Date of death: 07/29/2024
Place of death: St. Louis, MO

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

KATIE PROCTOR

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

My name is Frank Gutierrez, the grandfather of Amelia Gutierrez, who was murdered on January 13, 2005. To date, several requests for the records have been made, each time no response was given. 1 response was sent by email to my son, John Gutierrez, the biological father, which was met with a response asking how much of the report did he want. His requested an entire copy, and to do date, his response was ignored, and no records were sent. No response to the request was made. Can you please send a copy of these records?

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Frank Gutierrez
